QUESTION.QUESTION_INSTRUCTION:
1) Please write java code inside the method 'shortenedString(String inputData, char charcterToBeRemoved)'.

2) Please implement this method to remove the duplicate character from the string.

3) The method is expected to return given output of following input provided to it showing below.

InputOutput
input="welcome";char occurence = 'o';welcme
input="hello world";char occurence = 'l';"heo word"
input="Amazing";char occurence = 'a';mzing
input="Johnson john";char occurence = 'J';ohnson john"
input="GrEettingEe";char occurence = 'E';Grettinge
Please do not change class name and method name
QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION:
public class MyClassOne {
public static String shortenedString (String inputData, char charcterToBeRemoved)
{
/*
Please write your code here
*/
return null; }

public static void main(String arr[])
{
/* shortenedString("welcome","o");*/
}
}
QUESTION.ANSWER:
public class MyClassOne
{
public static String shortenedString (String inputData, char charcterToBeRemoved)
{
/*
Please write your code here
*/
return "welcme" }

public static void main(String arr[])
{
/* shortenedString("welcome","o");*/
}
}

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void shortenedString1(){ String input="welcome";char occurence = 'o'; String answer="welcme"; assertEquals(answer,shortenedString(input,occurence) );}
@Test public void shortenedString2(){ String input="hello world";char occurence = 'l'; String answer="heo word"; assertEquals(answer,shortenedString(input,occurence) );}
@Test public void shortenedString3(){ String input="Amazing";char occurence = 'a'; String answer="mzing"; assertEquals(answer,shortenedString(input,occurence) );}
@Test public void shortenedString4(){ String input="Johnson john";char occurence = 'J'; String answer="ohnson john"; assertEquals(answer,shortenedString(input,occurence) );}
@Test public void shortenedString5(){ String input="GrEettingEe";char occurence = 'E'; String answer="Grettinge"; assertEquals(answer,shortenedString(input,occurence) );}

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void CountOccurance1(){ String []input={"abc", "def", "ghi", "def", "xyz","abc","abc"};String s="abc"; assertEquals(3,CountOccurance(input,s));}
@Test public void CountOccurance2(){ String []input={"ab", "ef", "gh", "f", "xz","ab","ac"};String s="ab"; assertEquals(2,CountOccurance(input,s));}
@Test public void CountOccurance3(){ String []input={"abv", "xy", "ghi", "def", "xyz","x","a"};String s="x"; assertEquals(1,CountOccurance(input,s));}
@Test public void CountOccurance4(){ String []input={"abc", "def", "ghi", "def", "xyz","abc","abc"};String s="def"; assertEquals(1,CountOccurance(input,s));}
@Test public void CountOccurance5(){ String []input={"abc", "def", "ghi", "def", "xyz","abc","abc"};String s="abc"; assertEquals(0,CountOccurance(input,s));}

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How does session management work between Browser and Java application server (Tomcat). Please mark which of the below statements are true

OPTIONS.OPTION: Session is created by the server and is maintained by the server
Server maps each http request coming from the browser to a session using IP address of computer where request is coming from
Server maps each http request coming from browser using session Id sent in the request by the browser
Server send the session id back to browser as part of http response
Browser generates the session id and sends it to server
When one thread is executing X.f1(), another thread can execute X.f2() at the same time (concurrently)
When one thread is executing X.f1(), another thread can NOT execute X.f2() concurrently
Static methods cannot be synchronized
When X.f1() is executed, to synchronize the method JVM acquires lock on Class X
When X.f1() is executed, to synchronize the method JVM acquires lock on method f1()

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How is DNS (Domain name server) used

OPTIONS.OPTION: DNS converts domain name (website name) to IP address
DNS gives domain names to IP address of various websites
Browser sends the HTTP request to DNS and DNS sends the request to website server after converting it to ip address
Browser sends a DNS query to DNS, gets IP address back from DNS and using that IP address sends a HTTP request to website server
Browser sends the HTTP request to website and your ISP (Internet service provider) uses DNS to send that request to website server

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Which of the following statements are correct with respect to concept of virtual memory in operating systems

OPTIONS.OPTION: Virtual memory is part of secondary memory or hard disk which acts as part of primary/main memory
Virtual memory is additional memory/RAM that is installed on the computer
Operating System stores data from main memory to hard disk when it is not being actively used. This storage in hard disk is called virtual memory
Virtual memory is also known as swap space or swap memory
Virtual memory helps in running more applications than what main memory or RAM could support
